author: Omar Rashid
text:
Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav has demanded more funds from the Centre to provide safe drinking water in rural areas.

In a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Mr. Yadav said the release of funds was necessary to ensure “smooth execution” of the National Rural Drinking Water Programme.

Mr. Yadav has sought Rs.1,500 crore as annual assistance from the Centre for rural drinking water projects.

Stressing that it was the government’s responsibility to provide drinking water, the Chief Minister said it would not be in public interest to cut funds from this basic facility.
title: U.P. seeks more funds for water supply scheme
